Introduction and Context

The theme of the book and the concepts are explained by having a target of enhancing security and digital transformation. High Tech Rapid Solutions has a staff of over 60k. The company is trying to modernize their security operations due to COVID and having their employees to work remotely instead of traditional offices. They now require a new security monitoring strategy to address their security needs. The company has a SOC but they manage it themselves

Current Environment

  1. Multi cloud leveraging both Azure and AWS for infra needs
  2. Hybrid cloud having both on prem and cloud resources in order to maximize their compliance, while capitalizing on scalability and cost effectiveness
  3. Hybrid Identity architecture
  4. Entra ID to collaborate with external partners B2B collaboration with cross tenant capabilities
  5. Devices consists of 80% Windows and 20% mac, along with Android and iOS
  6. Majority of servers are windows based and the rest are linux
  7. Lagacy applications onprem while modern apps on cloud native technologies
  8. An IoT and OT environment to optimize operations. The main challenge it lacks is the lack of security monitoring and visibility

Security Challenges

  • Isolated products result in lack of visibility
  • Lack of centralized monitoring and analytics
  • Lack of a unified platform that impacts the agility of the incident response process. They use a legacy SIEM and are keen to move to a modern SIEM with a cloud based solution
  • Regulatory Compliances in terms of data protection, access controls and security audits

Management Concerns

  • Lack of visibility and control of IoT/OT environment
  • Lack of visibility on internet exposed digital assets
  • Lack of a threat intelligence data feed

Challenges emphasized by the Security team

  • Suspicious activity and confidential emails getting leaked
  • Struggling to gain visibility on vulnerabilities of the incidents
  • Limited resources that leads to incident response challenges
  • Long hours fulfilling management ad hoc reporting needs
  • Absence of a defined process and a dedicated vulnerability management team
  • Unauthorised users accessing HR apps and services
  • Team needs training for the new technologies
  • Too many false positives addressing these issues took a lot of time
  • Lack of monitoring on On prem identities
  • Lack of security posture management for both on prem and cloud resources
  • Failing to identify possible attack paths to cloud resources

Concerns by CISO

  • Attacks on m365 collaboration workloads
  • Ransomware Attacks
  • Business Email compromise Attacks
